Description: Solid cast pendant in the shape of a disc; thin, with strap- loop (made from intetral strip of metal at top of disc that is bent over to back, curled round and attached) at back; large boss in centre, circle of small bosses around edge (all hammered); very corroded.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
According to the EEF distribution list, from the "rubbish from the deposit with objects found" in the Aphrodite sanctuary.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QJ.22)
